text: The National Coordinating Committee to End the War in Vietnam was a group that became an umbrella anti-Vietnam war group.The making of the movement. SocialistWorker.org. Accessed May 6, 2012. Members of this group convinced Senator Eugene McCarthy to run in the primaries against Lyndon B. Johnson as an anti-war primary candidate.Organizing a Vietnam Protest. Wisconsin Historical Society. Accessed May 6, 2012. ==Archives== * George E. Rennar Papers. 1933-1972. 37.43 cubic feet. At the Labor Archives of Washington, University of Washington Libraries Special Collections. Contains materials about the National Coordinating Committee to End the War in Vietnam organization. ==See also== *List of anti-war organizations *List of peace activists *National Mobilization Committee to End the War in Vietnam ==References== Category:Anti–Vietnam War groups Category:Political advocacy groups in the United States
title: National Coordinating Committee to End the War in Vietnam
